text: The Bowls England National Championships (Women's Champion of Champions) is one of the events at the annual Bowls England National Championships. ==Past Winners== {|class="sortable wikitable" |- !width="30"|Year !width="250"|Champion !width="250"|Runner-up |- | align=center|2008|| Rebecca Smith (Essex) ||Katherine Hawes (Oxfordshire) |- | align=center|2009||Amy Monkhouse (Lincolnshire) ||Natalie Melmore (Devon) |- | align=center|2010||Katherine Hawes (Oxfordshire) ||Amy Monkhouse (Lincolnshire) |- | align=center|2011||Lynne Bowen (Worcestershire) ||Jo Skelton (Derbyshire) |- | align=center|2012||Amy Gowshall (Lincolnshire) ||Caroline Campion (Oxfordshire) |- | align=center|2013||Amy Gowshall (Lincolnshire) ||Julie Leake (Dorset) |- | align=center|2014||Helen McDermaid (Somerset) ||Jean Stephens (Cambridgeshire) |- | align=center|2015||Donna Brookes (Buckinghamshire) ||Carol Dixon (Leicestershire) |- | align=center|2016||Rebecca Wigfield (Northamptonshire)||Elaine Score (Essex) |- | align=center|2017||Ellen Falkner (Cambridgeshire) ||Kirsty Hembrow (Somerset) |- | align=center|2018||Amy Gowshall (Lincolnshire) || Katherine Hawes (Oxfordshire) |- | align=center|2019|| Ellen Falkner (Cambridgeshire) || Amy Gowshall (Lincolnshire) |- |align=center|2020|| cancelled || due to the COVID-19 pandemic. |} ==References== Category:Bowls in England
title: Bowls England National Championships (Women's Champion of Champions)
